name: Environmental Science Seminar
description: Scientists from within and external to the university share and discuss challenges, findings and opportunities. Specific topics (and speakers) vary from year to year but may draw from rehabilitation techniques, contaminants in our environment, environmental health, impacts on landscapes and communities, biodiversity, water, and modelling of environmental processes.
prerequisites: ENV316H1/ENV334H1/ENV337H1, completion of 12 FCE of courses, and enrolment in a School of the Environment BSc program; or permission of the Undergraduate Associate Director
